title.native: さよなら私のクラマー

description:
With no soccer accomplishments to speak of during the entirety of Sumire Suo’s junior high school years, the young wing gets an odd offer. Suo’s main rival, Midori Soshizaki, invites her to join up on the same team in high school, with a promise that she’ll never let Suo “play alone.” It’s an earnest offer, but the question is whether Suo will take her up on it. Thus the curtain opens on a story that collects an enormous cast of individual soccer-playing personalities!

(Source: Kodansha USA)

tags.name: Football
tags.description: Centers around the sport of football (known in the USA as "soccer").

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

title.native: さよなら私のクラマー
映画 さよなら私のクラマー ファーストタッチ
さよなら私のクラマー ミニアニメ

node.description: Manga artist Naoshi Arakawa made his debut in 2007 with Tsumetai Kousha no Toki wa Tomaru (The Time Stops on a Frozen Campus), a manga adaptation of the mystery novel by Mizuki Tsujimura. After finishing his original soccer series in 2010, Sayonara Football, he started his most renowned work, Your Lie in April, a series about the lives of young, talented classical musicians. In 2013, Your Lie in April won the Kodansha Manga Award and was then adapted into an anime series the following year.

__Graduated:__ Kunitachi College of Music (Department of Composition)

[Artist Profile (Miracle Bus)](http://miraclebus.com/composer/masaruyokoyama) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/masaruyokoyama)

**Yokoyama Masaru** is a Japanese composer, arranger, keyboardist and programmer affiliated with Miracle Bus.

**Residency:** Asagaya, Tokyo, Japan

**Takuno Seiki** is a Japanese director, episode director, production manager and storyboard artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋ナツコ)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/193091/)._

[Website](https://kobayashiaika.jp/s/n85/?ima=2313) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aikyan_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kyanstagram_/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNG7L36HtofjQk0FduxLxpw)

She's good at dancing. Her father is Japanese, while her mother is half Japanese and Korean. She learned ballet at the age of 5 and hip hop at third year of elementary school.

In 2011, she debuted as a singer for TV anime [Freezing](https://anilist.co/anime/9367/Freezing/) ending theme, "Kimi o Mamoritai" (君を守りたい) and was released as a split single with its opening theme. In 2012, she released a single for TV anime [Queen's Blade Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/11859/Queens-Blade-Rebellion/) ending theme, "Future is Serious". Both singles are released under Media Factory's record labels.

In 2015, she debuted as a voice actress with [Love Live! Sunshine!!](https://anilist.co/anime/21584/Love-Live-Sunshine/) as [Yoshiko Tsushima](https://anilist.co/character/89849/Yoshiko-Tsushima). She belongs to the idol group Aqours and its sub unit Guilty Kiss along with Rikako Aida and Aina Suzuki. She is nicknamed "Aikyan" by both fans and Aqours members.

In November 2016, she was announced to be one of the permanent hosts in Love Live! Sunshine!!'s radio program along with Anju Inami and Arisa Komiya.

Designed [her own parka](https://vvstore.jp/feature/detail/12383/).

__Height:__ 160 cm (5'3")

[Profile](http://www.hirata-office.jp/talent_profile/woman/mikako_komatsu.html) | [Artist Profile](https://www.toysfactory.co.jp/artist/mikakokomatsu/) | [Website](https://www.hirata-office.jp/komatsu_mikako/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mikakokomatsu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mikako_komatsu/)

A Japanese voice actor affiliated with Hirata Office. She married fellow voice actor [Tomoaki Maeno](https://anilist.co/staff/96489/Tomoaki-Maeno) on May 12, 2020.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Centi - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Feixiao - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)

__Eiko Morikawa__ is a Japanese sound effects editor. She started working at Swara Production, then went to Rakuonsha, and now is the representative director of Chura Sound.

(Source: AniDB)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).
In-betweener turned CG artist. Formerly affiliated with [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).

name.native: ホーバル・シェゲスタ・ダーレ

node.description:
[Website](https://habarudo.wordpress.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Habarudo) | [Tumblr](https://habarudo.tumblr.com/) | [DeviantArt](https://www.deviantart.com/habarudo) | [Vimeo](https://vimeo.com/habarudo) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/user/show/288)

Norwegian animator working for [Bug Films](https://anilist.co/studio/7348/BUG-FILMS) since November 2022. Previously worked for [Juumonji](https://anilist.co/studio/6219/Juumonji) between April 2019 to October 2022.

Some of his favorite animators include [Hiroyuki Okiura](https://anilist.co/staff/103502/Hiroyuki-Okiura), [Shingo Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114914/Shingo-Yamashita), [Toshiyuki Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/103724/Toshiyuki-Inoue), [Mitsuo Iso](https://anilist.co/staff/100151/Mitsuo-Iso) and [Yutaka Nakamura](https://anilist.co/staff/101801/Yutaka-Nakamura).

Graduated from Inland Norway University of Applied Sciences with a Bachelor in Visual Arts and Design in 2016.
